companyProfile.companyDescription: Reliance Industries Limited is engaged in the activities of hydrocarbon exploration and production, petroleum refining and marketing, petrochemicals, advanced materials and composites, renewables, retail and digital services. The Companyï¿½s segments include Oil to Chemicals (O2C), Oil and Gas, Retail, and Digital Services. The O2C segment covers refining, petrochemicals, fuel retailing, aviation fuel, and bulk wholesale marketing, with a portfolio that includes transportation fuels, polymers, polyesters, and elastomers. The Oil and Gas segment focuses on the exploration, development, and production of crude oil and natural gas. The Retail segment involves consumer retail and related services. The Digital Services segment provides a range of digital services. It also operates an oncology-focused healthcare platform, which focuses on technology-driven cancer care. Its subsidiaries include 7-India Convenience Retail Limited, Amante India Limited, Cover Story Clothing Limited, and others.

recentNews.headline: Tata Group stocks lead as 18 Nifty 50 stocks surge up to 37% in just 2 months. Do you own any?
recentNews.intro: 18 Nifty 50 stocks have rebounded sharply from their April lows, driven by improved investor sentiment and favourable conditions. Key gains were seen in the auto, pharma, and tech sectors, with Tata Motors leading a 37% recovery.
recentNews.imagecaption: Tata Group stocks lead as 18 Nifty 50 stocks surge up to 37% in little over 2 months

recentNews.headline: Reliance share price nears record high after 30% surge from April lows. More gains ahead?
recentNews.intro: Reliance Industries share price has surged 30% from April lows, reaching  ?1,448, with analysts predicting continued growth driven by retail recovery and telecom tariff repair. Target prices from JP Morgan and Bernstein have been raised, reflecting optimism in the company's long-term prospects.
recentNews.imagecaption: Reliance Industries share price nears record high after 30% surge from April lows. More gains ahead?

recentNews.headline: Afcons Infrastructure share price rises 6% on a large order win from Reliance
recentNews.intro: Stock Market Today: Afcons Infrastructure share price rises 6% during the intraday trades on a large order win from Reliance. The Letter of Award (LoA) from Reliance Industries Limited is worth  ?700 crore
recentNews.imagecaption: Stock Market Today: Afcons Infrastructure's large order win from Reliance.

recentNews.headline: Reliance share price jumps 18% YTD, outperforms Nifty 50; Jefferies, JP Morgan, Bernstein see more upside
recentNews.intro: Brokerage firms have a positive outlook on Reliance Industries, noting its strong growth potential and attractive valuation. The stock has seen an 18% year-to-date increase, despite a 2% decline over the past year, with target prices set by major firms ranging from  ?1,568 to  ?1,650.
recentNews.imagecaption: On a monthly scale, Reliance share price has been in the green since March this year, climbing nearly 2 per cent in June so far.  (AI-generated image)

recentNews.headline: This small-cap stock may be in focus on Monday after an order win from Reliance Industries. Do you own?
recentNews.intro: Afcons Infrastructure has won a  ?700 crore contract from Reliance Industries for Vinyl Projects in Dahej, Gujarat. Despite recent financial struggles, the small-cap stock has seen a slight recovery in June, climbing nearly 3% after a significant drop earlier this year.
recentNews.imagecaption: Small-cap stock Afcons Infrastructure could be under investors' radar on Monday, June 9.

recentNews.headline: ?My father had a burning desire??: Mukesh Ambani donates  ?151 crore to his Alma Mater ICT Mumbai
recentNews.intro: Mukesh Ambani announced a  ?151 crore grant to the Institute of Chemical Technology, Mumbai, honoring his former professor, MM Sharma, during a biography launch event. Ambani credited Sharma for influencing India's economic reforms and the growth of the Indian chemical industry.
recentNews.imagecaption: FILE PHOTO: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani.

recentNews.headline: Confirmed: BMC Selects Mukesh Ambani's Reliance To Develop Open Spaces Around Mumbai's Coastal Road
recentNews.intro: Nearly a year after Mumbai?s Coastal Road was opened to traffic, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has selected Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) to develop 53 hectares of reclaimed open space along the road. The company will take at least three to four months to prepare a plan, following which work on realising new open spaces along the road from Priyadarshini Park to Worli will commence, said sources in the civic body. Initially, the BMC had planned to develop open spaces along the  ?13,000-crore Coastal Road of its own accord. The plan was rolled back due to estimated additional expenditure of  ?400 crore and increased capital expenditure on big ticket projects including north-ward extension of the Coastal Road. Here's all you need to know
recentNews.keywords: Mint,Mint News,News,mumbai coastal road,mumbai coastal road project,mumbai,mumbai metro,green spaces mumbai,mumbai coastal,reliance mumbai park,coastal road park,coastal road,coastal road update,coastal road project,mumbai trans-harbour link road,sea road in mumbai,mumbai city,massive developments in mumbai,mumbai development,mumbai development plan 2034,mukesh ambani,reliance,mumbai news,ril,bmc,priyadarshini park,worli,mumbai development plan
recentNews.imagecaption: BMC Selects Reliance To Develop Open Spaces Around Mumbai's Coastal Road

recentNews.headline: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks
recentNews.intro: Nomura has raised its Nifty 50 target to 26,140 for March 2026, citing India's macroeconomic stability and potential. The upgrade reflects a 6% upside and focuses on domestic demand-driven sectors, supported by reforms and liquidity, despite global market uncertainties.
recentNews.imagecaption: Nomura raises Nifty target to 26,140 for March 2026, highlights 17 high-conviction stock picks

recentNews.headline: Another PLI scheme hits the Chinese wall, as India now mulls extension for projects under solar module incentive scheme
recentNews.intro: Industry players in the past few months have also reached out to the ministry of external affairs to relax visa restrictions for technicians which have also impacted project implementation.
recentNews.imagecaption: The  ?19,500 crore scheme for fully and partially integrated solar PV module manufacturing has scheduled commissioning dates from October 2024 to April 2026.

recentNews.headline: Mcap of four of top-10 most valued firms surges  ?1 lakh crore; LIC biggest gainer
recentNews.intro: LIC posted the largest gain, with its market cap soaring by  ?59,233.61 crore to reach  ?6,03,120.16 crore.
recentNews.imagecaption: Mcap of four of top-10 most valued firms surges  ?1 lakh crore; LIC biggest gainer.
